posts.title: Drugstore Cowboy
posts.excerpt: Cinepad.com wrote: The deadpan comic buzz you get from Gus Van Sant’s Drugstore Cowboy is practically narcotic. The movie heightens your senses and mildly anaesthetizes them at the same time, like a potent mixture of stimulants and depressants. One of the most invigoratingly original American comedies since Jim Jarmusch’s Stranger Than Paradise, Drugstore Cowboy follows …

posts.title: Occupy Love
posts.excerpt: OCCUPY LOVE captures the heart of the movement of movements that is sweeping the planet in response to today’s economic and environmental crises. ‘Philosopher-filmmaker’ Velcrow Ripper travels to history-making hot spots, asking the question, ‘How can crisis create a love story?’ Scenes include the Egyptian revolution in Tahrir Square, Spain’s Indignado movement, Occupy Wall Street …

posts._title: Baltasar Kormákur – Djúpið aka The Deep (2012)
posts.title: Djúpið
posts.excerpt: Based on actual events, a fisherman tries to survive in the freezing ocean after his boat capsizes off the south coast of Iceland.

posts._title: Manoel de Oliveira – O Gebo e a Sombra (2012)
posts.title: O Gebo e a Sombra
posts.excerpt: Gebo (Lonsdale) is an elderly accountant who lives with his wife Doroteia (Cardinale) and his daughter-in-law Sofia (Silveira). Despite his advanced age and increasing fatigue, he continues to work to provide for his family. Doroteia is concerned for her son João (Trêpa), who has been missing for some time. Gebo and Sofia have some idea …

posts._title: Jan Svankmajer – Neco z Alenky AKA Alice (1988)
posts.title: Neco z Alenky
posts.excerpt: Quote: Czech surrealist filmmaker Jan Svankmajer, who gained a reputation for his short subjects, makes his feature-film debut with Neco z Alenky, a grotesque look into the darkest, wildest recesses of a child’s mind. A surreal adaptation of Lewis Carroll’s children’s classic Alice in Wonderland, the film stars Kristyna Kohoutov? as Alice, the only human …

posts._title: Ulrich Seidl – Paradies: Glaube AKA Paradise: Faith (2012)
posts.title: Paradies: Glaube
posts.excerpt: Put together a subversive filmmaker like Ulrich Seidl with the subject of religious fanaticism and you’re bound to get something provocative. But Paradise: Faith, the second part of the Austrian director’s trilogy about three women from the same family on different quests, is possibly more interesting to think about and discuss afterwards than to sit …

posts._title: Budd Boetticher – Seven Men from Now [+Extra] (1956)
posts.title: Seven Men from Now
posts.excerpt: Seven Men from Now is a 1956 Western film directed by Budd Boetticher and starring Randolph Scott, Gail Russell, and Lee Marvin. The film was written by Burt Kennedy and produced by John Wayne’s Batjac Productions. Praised by the pioneering French critic Andre Bazin as “one of the most intelligent westerns I know but also …

posts._title: Endaf Emlyn – Gadael Lenin AKA Leaving Lenin (1993)
posts.title: Gadael Lenin
posts.excerpt: In 1993, a group of students and teachers from a Welsh secondary school visit St Petersburg to learn about Russian art, and to discover themselves in the process. Communication difficulties lead to the students and teachers becoming separated before they reach St Petersburg. Made by S4C in 1993, this was the first time that a …

posts._title: Paul Negoescu – O luna in Thailanda aka A Month in Thailand (2012)
posts.title: O luna in Thailanda
posts.excerpt: “A twenty-something generation that doesn’t know what it wants is laid bare with droll accuracy but also a dose of sympathy in this slow-burning romantic dramedy by young Romanian director Paul Negoescu. Following on in the new-wave Romanian tradition of stories that pan out in less than 24 hours, A Month In Thailand charts the …

posts.title: Sangre
posts.excerpt: Quote: Diego (Cirilo Recio) is a cross-eyed, middle-aged man who works as a doorman in a government building and spends the day counting the persons who pass in front of him. His younger wife Blanca (Laura Saldaña) works in a fast-food sushi bar. They do not have much to say to each other after a …
